Coffee n' Coke

A journal written by @coffeencoke which includes notes on software development and product design.

  • View On GitHub

This project is maintained by coffeencoke

Software Programming Resources

Interviewing Resources

A lot of the resources I’ve used in the past are included in the Coding Interview University github repo. This repo has a lot to offer for prepping for interviews, or just learning more about technical details of software.

Good Reads

  1. The Tao of Programming: Love this.
  2. Why’s (Poignant) Guide To Ruby: Love this too.
  3. Software Craftsmanship Manifesto: I sometimes resonate more with craftsman than I do with engineers.
  4. Agile Manifesto: It amazes me how many people claim to know “Agile”, but have never actually read this.
  5. Principles behind the Agile Manifesto: The often ignored sub-page.
  6. lowlevelprogramming-university

People

  1. Why The Lucky Stiff: Inspired me to learn Ruby, which launched my early years of software development.
    1. Why’s (Poignant) Guide To Ruby
    2. Why’s Disappearance
    3. Why’s Printer Spool
  2. Steve Klabnik
  3. Zach Holman, formerly at Github, lots to share about unconventional culture, inspires me to do what I love.
  4. Tom Preston-Werner
  5. Ilya Grigorik: Security and speed
  6. Ben Orenstein
  7. Jim Weirich
  8. James Edward Gray II
  9. risk danger olson
  10. Yehuda Katz

Companies

Podcasts

Languages

  • My primary language is Ruby
  • My secondary language is Javascript
  • Wanting to become proficient in java and python
  • I would like to dabble more in Go, and C.
